description: Sunny weekend day in the city?  Go sit outside at the Ramp or Kelly's Mission Rock and drink beer.  Cool, cloudy day in the city?  Go to the Ferry building (unless you feel like shopping - that's a whole other story).  Buy a few chunks of cheese at Cowgirl Creamery and some fresh bread at Acme.  Grab a table that is next to the main hallway for some prime people watching!  The Wine Merchant will not only let you bring all of that food in, they'll give you a cutting board and knife (they also sell their own cheese and meat plates)!   Sample the weekly tasting selections and if you like one, buy a bottle on your way out!  Prices are fair and the staff is knowledgeable and helpful.  Damn I love this city.
author: Kris N.

description: Read about this place in an Australian and NZ travel magazine...and it did not disappoint. Peter Granoff and his staff are friendly, knowledgable and keen for you to enjoy the wine tasting experience. The cheese plate is yummy. Each time I have visited there was a significant wait for a free table, but well worth the wait...shame it doesn't have views over the Bay..then you'd never get a table!!
author: Janet W.

description: This is a great wine shop where you are treated with respect.  They know their wine and they are happy to help.  I have always had great customer service when shopping there.  I also am a wine club member and I have never had a bad wine.   Its nice to try a variety of wines they select from all over the world.
author: Mickey D.

description: Love love love this place.  The wine is very affordable.  I went recently and had a flight of rose's, and a tasting of every red on the menu.  A friend and I also split the cheese plate and the meat plate.  Everything was delicious, its a great location and atmosphere for an after work get-together.  I will be back, for sure.
author: Emily d.

description:
I love it here!  Great wines, not seen all over the country.  Some exclusive offerings as well.  The wine bar is great, opens early for those looking for some bubbly to go with the fresh shucked oysters from Hog Island Oyster Co.  
And, the wines by the glass change often, so you want to go back and try more!
author: Megan C.

description: Great place - two glasses of wine and the cheeseboard - lovely.
author: Robert N.

description: The best wine deal in town..go with friends and enjoy the house wine if your on a budget. The Chard is unoaked and crisp...served chilled by a great staff for $15.00 a bottle. The other wines are great and it's hard to beat the "people watching" factor of the Ferry Building. I will go again and again..note bring lots of quaters for parking.
author: Kim F.

description: I think I found my favorite spot in the ferry building.  It's always packed here and it was the first time my bf and I actually sat down for drinks and lounge there a bit.  They had a lot of wines I haven't seen before on their list and their system was nice and handy to figure out if you'll like it but I kinda miss the descriptions I would recieve at other wine bars I've been to...however, a friendly question and recommendation from the bartenders there are so incredibly helpful.  Everything he recommended that night to my bf and I were good.  We ended up having 2 glasses of wine each and a gruyere and tomato olive tapanade.  AND he gave us a complimentary tasting of pinot...yums...You can't go wrong w/ cheese and wine.  We lounged there for awhile and just hung out.  Although it was crowded everyone was nice and friendly.  I do recommend sitting right at the bar so you get the bartender's attention and faster service although they still do pretty well for a packed place. *happy thoughts*
author: Kim D.

description: i had a lovely glass of french chablis with a client at the ferry plaza wine merchant the other day. the wine was delicious, and the staff was helpful and accommodating, but the most memorable part? the nibbles. my client said she remembered the time when the FPWM did not serve food, so you went to cowgirl creamery and acme bread first to pick up something to munch on, and brought it back to enjoy with your wine. well they clearly have their food menu on point now, because i had some really delicious black olives and mushrooms there! they were marinated in olive oil, rosemary and oregano, and i could not stop eating them. to get out the pits we had to give up our pretenses of being polite, and attack the olives with our hands, but it was well worth it. literally some of the best marinated mushrooms i have had to date.
author: Kris G.

description: I'll start off by saying that whenever I'm in the area to catch the boat home, I stop by and grab a bottle. Prices and selection are usually above par and they carry one of my favs. Although I don't frequent it quite enough to want to write a stellar review. Unfortunately after my experience tonight I felt the need to write the opposite. It was a casual Friday so I was in jeans, hoodie and carrying my backpack with my gym clothes. Immediately this time upon walking in a middle aged woman with bob-cut hair sized me up. It wasn't until she informed another employee to watch the small bottles because they disappear into people's backpacks that I got the feeling she was referring to me. I shrugged it off as a random comment but when she followed me around the store straightening bottles that were perfectly fine, it drove the point home. So I left feeling a dark cloud over my head. And all I wanted was my Bedrock. Anyways, an employee is the face of the company so that's why I give the worst star possible. Because bad service is one thing, but making a customer feel like a bad person for being in the store, that's a whole other ball game.
author: W Z.

description: Ok this is the first time I've gone here. They have a sign that says "seat yourself" so I figure they are going to look for me not the other way around. After a few minutes waiting (long enough to go through the binder on the table) I decide to go up to the counter and ask for help. Finally this guy comes up and I ask him how it works. He indicates the binder as the menu. I'm thinking "this place has dozens of bottles where is a nice list of wines by the glass" To my mind they don't have very much listed. First he tells me we have to buy a bottle cos it's Wednesday. Apparently that's what passes for a joke there. Then he points out the pitiful list of wines by the glass. Ok so we go pick a bottle. No prices of course. Then half a loaf of 2.00 bread from acme bakery and half a small Mt Tam cheese is 12 bucks and 12 olives are 6.50. What a rip off! Oh yeah we ask for water and he automatically up sells us with a bottle of still water that we have to buy instead of tap. God I hate places like this. I don't care if the who's who of winemakers are here it's not the kind of place I like. Typical elitist place. I cannot recommend the service or the prices.
author: claire k.

description: I used to work near the Ferry Building when it first opened and I remember being very impressed by how friendly, accessible, and knowledgeable the Wine Merchant staff were.  HOWEVER, I went in last week to buy a bottle of sherry, after not having been in for quite a while.  Not only did several staff walk right by me, even though I was clearly not seeing what I was looking for, but when I had decided on a bottle and the guy behind the register was ringing it up, he was tres rude.  I asked him about where he might suggest I look for a particular label/style I had liked when I visited Jerez, Spain (the sherry region), and it was seriously ALL he could do not to roll his eyes.  As he answered me (telling me I should try BevMo or Safeway for something like that) he kept looking over my shoulder.  I actually turned around, wondering if there was someone he was making eye contact with or to see if I was holding up the line.  No.  He was just DONE with me and my silly question.  I almost walked away from the purchase, but really wanted the bottle.  I will never purchase from here again.  I hate to do it to a small business, but one bad customer service incident really can make the difference.
author: Kathryn F.

description: I stopped going here when I saw that they sell wine from the Occupied Territories.  Boycotting it hasn't been any great loss since the wines were pretty run of the mill and overpriced anyway.
author: D C.

description: helpful and knowledgeable wine staff.  they are known to recommend local up and coming wine producers.  im glad someone's supporting the little guys.  the wines can be a tad on the pricier side.
author: Dorothy L.

description: This place was packed on valentines day so we decided to buy the wine and go.  They were extremely helpful in answering our questions and suggesting cheese that we could pair since we decided to do our wine tasting at home.
author: Kalifornia S.

description: They don't have a lot due to size I guess but it's nice to hang here for some reason.  I guess being the Ferry Building and that whole ambiance.  You get to hang a bit and imbibe and buy-perfect!
author: Misti L.
